Pybullet Simulator

Modules

PybulletCore

class src.core.pybullet_core.PybulletCore

Pybullet Simulator Core Class

connect(robot_name='indy7_v2', joint_limit=True, constraint_visualization=True)

Connect to Pybullet GUI

Parameters:

  • robot_name (string) – robot name want to import, defaults to ‘indy7_v2’

  • joint_limit (bool) – activate/deactivate the joint limit constraint, defaults to True

  • constraint_visualization (bool) – activate/deactivate the constraint visualizer, defaults to True

disconnect()

Disconnect to Pybullet GUI

MoveRobot(q, degree=True, verbose=False)

Move the robot to the given joint angle

PybulletRobot

class src.core.pybullet_robot.PybulletRobot(ClientId, robot_info, dt)

Pybullet Simulator Robot Class

Parameters:

  • ClientId (int) – pybullet GUI client’s ID

  • robot_info (dict[]) – dictionary of robot’s information

  • dt (float) – simulation time step

robot_update()

Update the state of the robot by implementing _pre_robot_update, _get_robot_states, _compute_torque_input, _control_robot, and _post_robot_update methods.

property q
Returns:

robot’s current joint poses (rad)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property qdot
Returns:

robot’s current joint velocities (rad/s)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property qddot
Returns:

[NOT WORK!!!] robot’s current joint accelerations (rad/s^2)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property q_des
Returns:

robot’s desired joint poses (rad)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property p
Returns:

robot’s current task pose (xyz, xi)

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-1)

property T_end
Returns:

robot’s current task pose (SE3)

Return type:

np.ndarray (4-by-4)

property tau
Returns:

robot’s current input torques (Nm)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property Js
Returns:

Spatial jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-n)

property Jb
Returns:

Body jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-n)

property Jr
Returns:

Jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-n)

JsInv()
Returns:

Inverse of the spatial jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-6)

Jbinv()
Returns:

Inverse of the body jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-6)

property Jrinv
Returns:

Inverse of the jacobian in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-n)

property M
Returns:

Mass matrix of the robot in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-n)

property C
Returns:

Coriolis matrix of the robot in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-n)

property c
Returns:

Coriolis vector of the robot in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property g
Returns:

Gravity vector of the robot in robot’s current configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property q_lower
Returns:

Lower joint pose limits (rad)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

property q_upper

Upper joint pose limits (rad)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)

jacobian(q)
Parameters:

q (np.ndarray) – given robot joint position (rad)

Returns:

jacobian in given configuration

Return type:

np.ndarray (6-by-n)

forward_kinematics(q)
Parameters:

q (np.ndarray) – given robot joint position (rad)

Returns:

task pose corresponded to the given joint position (SE3)

Return type:

np.ndarray (4-by-4)

inverse_kinematics(T)
Parameters:

T (np.ndarray) – given robot target pose in SE3

Returns:

joint pos corresponded to the given task pose (rad)

Return type:

np.ndarray (n-by-1)
